See also: durch-

Czech[edit]

Noun[edit]

durch m

  1. A single deal within a game of mariáš in which one player wins against the other two if he takes all the tricks.
    Synonym: velký
    Antonym: betl

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German durch, from Old High German duruh, from Proto-Germanic *þurhw.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /dʊʁç/, /dʊɐ̯ç/ (standard)
  • IPA(key): /dʊɐ̯x/, /dʊɪ̯ç/ (regionally)
  • audio (Germany
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Preposition[edit]

durch (+ accusative)

  1. by means of; by; through
  2. through; entering, then exiting
  3. via
  4. owing to; because of
  5. (mathematics) divided by

Adverb[edit]

durch

  1. during; throughout; through
    den ganzen Tag durch ― the whole day through
  2. (colloquial, with a time) past
    Es ist acht Uhr durch. ― It is past eight o’clock.

Derived terms[edit]

  • durch und durch
  • durchaus

Related terms[edit]

  • durch- (used in compounds)

Further reading[edit]

  • durch (preposition) in Duden online
  • durch (adverb) in Duden online
